title: José Andrés, founder of World Central Kitchen, a chef on the front line
summary: Spanish-American chef José Andrés is the founder of the NGO that, since 2010, has been providing millions of meals to disaster-stricken populations. On April 1, seven of his employees were killed by Israeli missile fire in Gaza. A philanthropist who wields great influence in the US, his methods sometimes raise questions.

title: French air traffic controller strike: Up to 75% of flights canceled in Paris Orly on Thursday
summary: Airlines will also be forced to cancel 65 percent of flights at Paris Charles de Gaulle airport and in Marseille. Major delays should also be expected.

title: In Florida, Biden keeps attacking Trump on abortion
summary: US President Joe Biden spoke about abortion rights at a university in Tampa, on Tuesday, saying that voters will hold his Republican predecessor and opponent personally 'accountable' in November.

title: In India, Islamophobia gains ground in election campaign
summary: Without naming them, India's prime minister, speaking at a rally for the general elections, described Muslims as 'infiltrators' who 'have the most children.'

title: German far-right MEP's assistant accused of being a Chinese spy
summary: A close associate of Maximilian Krah, lead candidate for the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party in the June 9 elections, Jian G. was arrested in Dresden.

title: Rudy Gobert: 'The Olympics at home only happens once in a lifetime, we have to enjoy every moment of it'
summary: Le Monde met with the French basketball team and Minnesota Timberwolves center at his home in Minneapolis. He talked about his Olympic ambitions and his desire to be the flag bearer for the French delegation.

title: US Democratic cities take homelessness crisis to the Supreme Court
summary: Municipalities on the West Coast are asking Supreme Court judges to give them the means to ban homeless people from sleeping in public spaces.

title: Russia's use of prisoners to feed war machine is widespread
summary: A law passed at the end of March allows suspects to escape conviction if they choose to go fight on the front lines in Ukraine.

title: ECB vice president Luis de Guindos: 'June interest rate cut is a fait accompli'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Luis de Guindos said he believes the eurozone is close to winning the battle against inflation.

title: Azerbaijan says 'closer than ever' to Armenia peace deal amid border talks
summary: Teams from the two countries headed to the border to start demarcation work, hoping to end decades of territorial disputes.

title: In Argentina, students protest against government's austerity plan leading to public university cuts
summary: Since last July, the University of Buenos Aires has received 8.9% of its total budget from the state. The university says that's barely enough to keep lights on. A teachers' union reported a million protesters countrywide on Tuesdq\ay.

title: Head of Israel's military intelligence is first senior official to resign over October 7 attacks
summary: Major General Aharon Haliva resigned on Monday following the intelligence failures that allowed Hamas to carry out its bloody attack.

title: Sales falling, prices cuts... Tesla's revenues plummeted 55% in first quarter
summary: The company appears to be counting on a vehicle built to be a fully autonomous taxi as the catalyst for future earnings growth. CEO Elon Musk has said the robotaxi will be unveiled on August 8.

title: Southeast Asia hit by extreme heat wave
summary: In Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia, Vietnam and the Philippines, temperatures are reaching 40° or even 45°C.

title: UNRWA can be improved but is 'indispensable' to Palestinians, independent review states
summary: Monday's report into the UN agency for Palestinians noted Israel had yet to provide evidence for allegations that staff were members of terrorist organizations.

title: In 'Back to Black,' Amy Winehouse is made out of music and love
summary: With this biopic dedicated to the British singer who died at the age of 27, Sam Taylor-Johnson succeeds in embodying the vertigo of the artistic gesture.

title: Columbia University deeply fractured by war in Gaza
summary: Over 100 pro-Palestinian students were arrested on campus last week as the university moved to hybrid classes for the rest of the semester, a few days after the university president's congressional hearing on antisemitism.

title: 21 dead after migrant boat capsizes off Djibouti
summary: Another 33 people survived the disaster, 23 are still missing.

title: In Tennessee, lawmakers pass bill to allow teachers to be armed
summary: If Republican Gov. Bill Lee signs it into law, it would be the biggest expansion of gun access in the state since last year's deadly shooting at a private elementary school in Nashville.
